summary: This is an FBI News Briefing dated December 8, 2020, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes a brief mention of Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys seeking bail, but the document is primarily a daily news digest covering politics, COVID-19, criminal investigations, and other current events, not a case-specific document.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in a brief news item stating her attorneys are seeking her release on bail, noting she has lost weight and hair under jail conditions.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who claimed her client suffers under onerous jail conditions.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Judge who will decide later in the month whether to conduct a bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the onetime boyfriend of Ghislaine Maxwell, whose suicide is cited as a reason for her strict jail conditions.

connections.description: Described as the onetime girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein.
Bobbi Sternheim is acting as a defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Attorneys Seek Bail for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys renewed her application for bail, citing onerous jail conditions and her deteriorating health (weight and hair loss). The judge will decide later in the month on a hearing.

keyFacts: The document is an FBI News Briefing, a daily digest of news, not a primary case document.
It contains a single, brief item about Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys seeking bail for her.
The Maxwell item references Jeffrey Epstein's suicide as a factor in her strict jail conditions.
The vast majority of the document covers unrelated news topics like the 2020 election, COVID-19, and other criminal investigations.
No new substantive allegations or evidence regarding the Epstein case are presented in this briefing.
